title: How was the childhood of Emperor Ashoka? - Quora

response.answer_text: Emperor Ashoka !  Ashoka was the third emperor of the Mauryan Dynasty and ruled almost the entire Indian subcontinent. Read more at Ashoka Biography Ashoka was born as Devanampriya Priyadarshi Samrat Ashoka, in 304 BC, in Pataliputra (close to modern-day Patna), to the second emperor of the Mauryan Dynasty, Bindusara, and Maharani Dharma. His childhood was full of ups and downs. He was the favourite child of his father Bindusar because Ashoka was so active and Intelligent since then.  Born into a royal family, he was good at fighting since childhood and received royal military training. Besides, he was also excellent at hunting, evident from his ability to kill a lion with only a wooden rod. Read more at Ashoka Biography Bindusar had few wives and the mother of Ashoka was the one Bindusar loved the most! She was loyal unlike the others and hence she was always on the target to seperate her from Bindusar. The greatest, wisest of all time Chanakya had all the trust and faith of Bindusar. Chanakya was the chief adviser of the king of empire. Ashoka was popular in his empire because of his love towards people and his devotion since his childhood.   Ashoka was a kind person and thats why he always used to let go off the things his siblings would do to him. But once his brother from another mother named Sushim tried to kill him, it was the time when Ashoka realized what was actually happening. Later all these things were introdeuced to Bindusar and Ashoka was declared as the New Emperor.
